page.title: 13Eversley Forestry Commission
page.content: We interviewed Mr. Leemans who is a forester at Bramshill.He told us that most of the trees in our area are pine, but that there are some oak,cherry and chestnut.The timber from them is used to make posts and chipboard.The local forestry where he works covers 4,5OO acres.Some of the wood is exported.There are twenty men and three foresters employed. They work from 7.3Oa.m. until 4.OOp.m. most days but they sometimes need to work overtime.There are four different jobs carried out.There are harvesters, plank workers,foresters and motorway workers. When the trees have been felled they are transported by 32 ton lorries to various destinations. The foresters have about 4,OOO trees in every acre to care for.
